title: If God created Adam and Eve, how did they populate the world with only two sons? - Quora

Firstly, Adam and Eve are not recorded as the 'first people', but only Adam is specified as 'First human being' when he was created. 'First' denotes that there is a second, as well as a millionth, but when Eve was then created the Bible does not speak of her as the second human being… meaning she possibly wasn't, nor was she the first female either. Why? Well i believe, since God was creating, he didn't stop on Adam, he created more as he would do Eve... Remember he said “let us create man…and let 'THEM' rule….", So he created a lot of THEM beginning with Adam; do you think God created only one human being (Adam) and left him on the whole planet, earth with a population of one individual (where then would be the ..'THEM'...), then came Eve to make it a census if 2? The story of Adam & Eve gives impression as if they were the only 2 inhabitants of earth till they had children, well probably because only the account of these two's family is told. Why them you may ask, well, since they were a bit special by being the sole custodians of God's much loved garden of Eden, the garden which had the 2 Divine sacred trees now placed in heaven itself where God dwells. Adam & Eve become more notable also or primarily because we all then fall in their lineage as the rest of the story unfolds..... This would then answer the question, "where did the other people possibly come from if not from Adam?", E.g. city of Nod... Well, creation went on. EDIT:Gen 2v24When Eve was brought to Adam, the Bible quotes something important with regard to how Cain and siblings got married "...a man shall leave his mother and father (parents/family)", meaning there were other families/parents outside Eden to talk about, families to which Cain and siblings went and married e.g. in the city of Nod Gen 4v16 Gen 1v28The scripture "...multiply and fill the earth..." were given to 'THEM' all mankind, not specifically to Adam and Eve alone since they were not the only family/parents from creation.
